edu.columbia.cs.sdarts.common
Class LSPContentSummary

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--edu.columbia.cs.sdarts.common.LSPObject
        |
        +--edu.columbia.cs.sdarts.common.LSPContentSummary
public class LSPContentSummary
extends LSPObject

Represents an "scontent-summary", as defined in the STARTS 1.0 spec. Currently, because of the large size of content summariese and the limitations of the SDLIP transport layer, content summaries are not return by the FrontEndLSP. Rather, in general, their text XML representations are made available via standard HTTP. However, an object version of this header is still needed for content-summary creation and storage on the back-end, and may be available via the FrontEndLSP in the future.

The back end developer instantiates this object and returns it from the getContentSummary() method of BackEndLSP.

See the STARTS Specification for the meanings of all the properties stored in this class.

public LSPContentSummary(boolean stemming,
                         boolean stopWords,
                         boolean caseSensitive,
                         boolean fields,
                         int numDocs)
Create an LSPContentSummary
Parameters:
stemming - whether the underlying collection supported stemming
stopWords - whether the underyling collection supports stop-words
caseSensitive - whether the underyling collection supports case-sensitive queries
fields - whether field names appear with the terms in a content summary
numDocs - the number of documents in the underlying collection

toXML

public void toXML(XMLWriter writer)
           throws java.io.IOException
Generates an XML representation of LSPContentSummary, and writes it directly to a Writer. This method is safer to call because LSPContentSummaries tend to be huge - best to write it directly to disk or the network.
Overrides:
toXML in class LSPObject
Parameters:
depth - the depth in a nested XML string that this element appears
